Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About our company

Breast cancer is the most treatable cancer, yet it remains the leading cause of death by cancer in women‚Äîlargely because national screening programs miss up to 1 in 3 cases. The problem is even worse for women with dense breasts, who make up 50% of the screening population and for whom mammography is less reliable. At The Blue Box, we've developed a urine-based breast cancer test with a sensitivity of 88.42%, outperforming mammography by 15% overall‚Äîand by 30% in women with dense breasts. We're launching clinical trials in 2025 and bringing our test to gynecology clinics by 2026.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and spearhead the technical aspects of our breast cancer diagnostic device development. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, a teamwork-oriented mindset, and a passion for driving innovation in healthcare.

¬†

Job Description

Lead improvements in AI algorithms based on processing and data analysis of clinical examinations gathered with the device, prioritizing sensitivity and specificity for challenging classes.
Design and implement preprocessing pipelines: signal denoising, normalization, scaling, and feature extraction.
Keep our comprehensive dataset up to date, addressing data scarcity challenges.
Lead troubleshooting efforts and provide technical expertise to resolve complex issues encountered during development of AI models.¬†
Collaborate with our Head of Engineering and Clinical Lead in optimizing the quality of data readings obtained with our device.
Collaborate with our QA/RA Lead to ensure that all technical aspects of the AI algorithm development adhere to quality standards, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.¬†




Requirements

Advanced degree in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Physics, Mathematics or a related field.
Proven track record of hands-on experience (‚â•3 years), ideally in the development of algorithms of pre-processing codes to classify multidimensional time series data, preferably in the field of Biology.
Experience in cross-validation strategies and handling class imbalance.
(Bonus) Knowledge of electronics and sensor signal acquisition.
Strong collaborative mindset, open to iterative model refinement based on feedback from engineers and clinicians. Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to non-technical teams (e.g., Quality and Regulatory Office, Clinical Office‚Ä¶).
Fluency in English.




About the team

This is an in-person job with one optional work-from-home day per week. Our office space is at StartUB! (Barcelona). The current team is integrated by 8 people: CEO, Tech Lead, Operations Lead, Clinical Lead, QA/RA Manager, Project Manager, Lab Technician, Software Engineer.

Desired start date: June 2nd




How to apply

Please submit your application via LinkedIn including:

Your CV
When you‚Äôd be able to start working with us. If you need to relocate to Barcelona, when you‚Äôd be able to start working in person




#MachineLearning #AI #DeepLearning #DataPreprocessing #TimeSeries #BiologicalData #Classification

About our company

Breast cancer is the most treatable cancer, yet it remains the leading cause of death by cancer in women‚Äîlargely because national screening programs miss up to 1 in 3 cases. The problem is even worse for women with dense breasts, who make up 50% of the screening population and for whom mammography is less reliable. At The Blue Box, we've developed a urine-based breast cancer test with a sensitivity of 88.42%, outperforming mammography by 15% overall‚Äîand by 30% in women with dense breasts. We're launching clinical trials in 2025 and bringing our test to gynecology clinics by 2026.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and spearhead the technical aspects of our breast cancer diagnostic device development. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, a teamwork-oriented mindset, and a passion for driving innovation in healthcare.

  • Design and implement preprocessing pipelines: signal denoising, normalization, scaling, and feature extraction.
  • Keep our comprehensive dataset up to date, addressing data scarcity challenges.
  • Lead troubleshooting efforts and provide technical expertise to resolve complex issues encountered during development of AI models. 
  • Collaborate with our Head of Engineering and Clinical Lead in optimizing the quality of data readings obtained with our device.
  • Collaborate with our QA/RA Lead to ensure that all technical aspects of the AI algorithm development adhere to quality standards, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices. 


Requirements

  • Advanced degree in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Physics, Mathematics or a related field.
  • Proven track record of hands-on experience (‚â•3 years), ideally in the development of algorithms of pre-processing codes to classify multidimensional time series data, preferably in the field of Biology.
  • Experience in cross-validation strategies and handling class imbalance.
  • (Bonus) Knowledge of electronics and sensor signal acquisition.
  • Strong collaborative mindset, open to iterative model refinement based on feedback from engineers and clinicians. Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to non-technical teams (e.g., Quality and Regulatory Office, Clinical Office‚Ä¶).
  • Fluency in English.


About the team

This is an in-person job with one optional work-from-home day per week. Our office space is at StartUB! (Barcelona). The current team is integrated by 8 people: CEO, Tech Lead, Operations Lead, Clinical Lead, QA/RA Manager, Project Manager, Lab Technician, Software Engineer.

Desired start date: June 2nd


How to apply

Please submit your application via LinkedIn including:

  1. Your CV
  2. When you‚Äôd be able to start working with us. If you need to relocate to Barcelona, when you‚Äôd be able to start working in person

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ADP is hiring a Senior Data Scientist

In this role, as a data scientist in the People Analytics & Insights team at ADP, you will work to increase data driven insights to assist our leaders in making better people decisions to add value through improved business outcomes or a better associate experience.

This role is ideal for an individual with a solid foundation in machine learning, programming, and AI, as well as a passion for transforming data into actionable insights. You will be solving complex data problems with a multi-disciplinary team of scientists, engineers and talent management experts.

What You'll Do

Here's what you can expect on a typical day in the life of a Senior Data Scientist at ADP.


Work with large datasets to collect, process, and integrate data from various sources. Conduct statistical analysis to derive actionable insights. Expertise in data processing and manipulation using Python, R, or SQL.
Research, develop, and implement robust machine learning models to identify patterns, make predictions, and solve business problems. Test and evaluate model, tune and tweak parameters as needed to improve performance.
Write efficient, readable code using Python or R to automate tasks and streamline workflows. Strong programming skills, proficiency in Python or R, experience in Cloud platforms AWS, Azure.
Develop and build AI solutions using deep learning, LLMs, NLP as applicable to business needs. Familiar with AI techniques such as deep learning, LLMs, RAG, and NLP.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML, and data science to propose new methods or tools to improve workflows, enhance model performance, and provide better solutions.
Communicate insights from analyses to management or stakeholders to enable data driven decision making based on machine learning and statistical analysis results.


Advanced degree (OR equivalent) in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or a related field. Ph.D. preferred. 1-3 years of experience in a machine learning /data science role.

To Succeed In This Role


Solid background in Machine Learning algorithms, gradient boosting, tree-based, ensemble, Bayesian, clustering; including supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning techniques. Deep knowledge in statistical modeling and methods. Excellent analytical skills ‚Äì ability to analyze large datasets, detect and correct errors, interpret and report analysis results.


You'll Love Working Here Because You Can


Team collaboration. Courage comes from how associates are willing to have difficult conversations, speak up, be an owner, and challenge one another's ideas to net out the best solution.
Deliver at epic scale. We deliver real user outcomes using strong judgment and good instincts. We're obsessed with the art of achieving simplicity with a focus on client happiness and productivity.
Be surrounded by curious learners. We align ourselves with other smart people in an environment where we grow and elevate one another to the next level. We encourage our associates to listen, stay agile, and learn from mistakes.
Act like an owner & doer. Mission-driven and committed to navigating change, you will be encouraged to take on any challenge and solve complex problems. No tasks are beneath or too great for us. We are hands-on and willing to master our craft.
Give back to others. Always do the right thing for our clients and our community and humbly give back to the community where we live and work. Support our associates in times of need through ADP's Philanthropic Foundation.
Join a company committed to equality and equity. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions.


A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP‚Äôs operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP‚Äôs culture and our full set of values.

Title: Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)
Description:
Job Reference

88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Position

Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)

Closing Date

Wednesday, 07 May, 2025

Reference: 88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Job title: Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputaci√≥n (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain. It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe. The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress. BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

Look At The BSC Experience

BSC-CNS YouTube Channel

Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research. In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

If you consider that you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to continue applying for the job offer. We value diversity of experiences and skills, and you could bring unique perspectives to our team.

Context And Mission

We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineer with expertise in machine learning, data science, or computational environmental sciences to contribute to cutting-edge research in Earth Sciences.

The selected candidate will play a key role in developing and optimizing machine learning workflows for large-scale land-use, land-cover, and Leaf Area Index (LAI) reconstruction, supporting both historical and future climate scenarios.

This position involves integrating deep learning models, refining data workflows, and contributing to predictive modeling efforts within multiple European projects, including TerraDT and CONCERTO. It builds upon methodologies established in the CERISE project and aims to generate high-resolution, temporally extended datasets to improve climate model simulations and advanced Earth system modeling capabilities.

This role provides a unique opportunity to work with an interdisciplinary team of machine learning researchers and climate scientists. The team will focus on developing scalable solutions for processing and analyzing high-dimensional environmental data. The selected candidate will also contribute to scientific publications, project documentation, and technical reporting, collaborating on research efforts within international projects.

Key Duties


Develop and optimize large-scale machine learning workflows for Earth Science applications, focusing on land-use, land-cover, and LAI downscaling for both historical and future scenarios.
Implement and evaluate deep learning architectures for predictive modeling of land-use, land-cover, and climate-related variables, while developing model evaluation methodologies, including visualization and validation tools to compare deep learning models with traditional baselines.
Refactor and modularize existing machine learning pipelines to improve scalability, efficiency, and deep learning integration.
Work with large geospatial datasets (NetCDF, Zarr) and optimize data processing workflows for high-performance computing (HPC) environments.
Ensure that reconstructed land-use, land-cover, and LAI datasets align with Earth system modeling requirements.
Participate in scientific publications and technical reporting, contributing to documentation, with opportunities to be involved in academic publications and project reporting.


Requirements


Education
Bachelor or Master‚Äôs in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Environmental Sciences, or a related field.
Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in machine learning libraries such as PyTorch and Scikit-learn.
Proven experience in developing and training machine learning models, particularly deep learning architectures.
Strong background in handling, analyzing, and validating large-scale geospatial datasets.
Experience working in a UNIX-based computational environment.
Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience
Familiarity with climate, weather, and Earth system datasets (NetCDF, Zarr).
Experience in high-performance computing (HPC) and parallelized machine learning workflows.
Proficiency in GPU-accelerated machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, RAPIDS, JAX and/ or distributed training using Dask.
Understanding of climate and weather models.
Competences
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to optimize computational workflows.
Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively in a research environment.
Excellent communication skills, with a strong ability to document and present research findings.
Proficiency in written and spoken English.

Conditions


The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department
We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures
Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration
Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement
Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
Starting date: 01/03/2025


Applications procedure and process

All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:


A full CV in English including contact details
A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered. Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included. Applications without this document will not be considered.


Development of the recruitment process

The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposici√≥n"). The recruitment process consists of two phases:


Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position. - 40 points
Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources. In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated. - 60 points. A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.


The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes. For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact recruitment@bsc.es.

For more information, please follow this link.

Deadline

The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired. Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.

OTM-R principles for selection processes

BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R). This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc.

BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

For more information follow this link

Application Form

You are applying for the following job offer

Name and Surname *

Gender ** *

Female

Email *

Nationality** *

Where did you first see this job offer (Please indicate the name of the website, social media, referral etc.)? *

please choose one of this and if needed describe the option : - BSC Website - Euraxess - Spotify - HiPeac - LinkedIn - Networking/Referral: include who and how - Events (Forum, career fairs): include who and how - Through University: include the university name - Specialized website (Metjobs, BIB, other): include which one - Other social Networks: (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Youtube): include which one - Other (Glassdoor, ResearchGate, job search website and other cases): include which one

Indicate what BSC department/s you want to apply.

Computer Sciences

CASE

Life Sciences

Earth Sciences

Indicate what research group/s you want to apply.

Upload CV (select the file, then click the Upload button) *

Please, upload your CV document using the following name structure: Name_Surname_CV

Files must be less than 3 MB.

Allowed file types: txt rtf pdf doc docx.

Cover Letter (optional) (if so, select the file and then click the Upload button)

Please, upload your CV document using the following name structure: Name_Surname_CoverLetter

Files must be less than 3 MB.

Allowed file types: txt rtf pdf doc docx zip.

Other Documents (optional) (if so, select the file and then click the Upload button)

Please, upload your CV document using the following name structure: Name_Surname_OtherDocument

Files must be less than 10 MB.

Allowed file types: txt rtf pdf doc docx rar tar zip.


Consider that the information provided in relation to gender and nationality will be used solely for statistical purposes.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a talented and passionate Data Scientist to join the Lifecycle Data team in our Barcelona HQ.

Data Science, Machine Learning, and Experimentation are key drivers of Glovo‚Äôs customer engagement strategy. Data scientists at Lifecycle own some of the most impactful models and insights that optimize Glovo‚Äôs user retention and loyalty. This includes churn prediction models, customer segmentation, lifetime value modeling, and personalized recommendation engines. As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to work on projects that directly impact Glovo‚Äôs ability to maximize user engagement, retention, and overall lifetime value.

THE JOURNEY


Develop, test, and productionize predictive and prescriptive algorithms using state-of-the-art machine learning, statistical inference, and optimization models.
Evaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g., cross-validation) and online experiments (e.g., A/B testing, uplift modeling).
Contribute to one or more of the following areas: churn prediction, customer segmentation, lifetime value modeling, and personalized recommendations.
Design and implement experiments to measure the effectiveness of lifecycle initiatives, providing actionable insights to product and marketing teams.
Work in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, growth, and CRM, amongst others.
Stay on top of new technologies and industry trends in data science, customer analytics, and retention strategies.
Promote best-in-class standards, taking inspiration from industry thought leaders.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in at least one of the following areas: traditional machine learning, statistical modeling, causal inference, customer analytics, time series analysis, and optimization.
Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:
Strong data modeling and SQL skills.
Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (GCP, AWS, Azure).
Extensive experience using the Python ML and DS ecosystem.
Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds.
Working knowledge of agile development.
Change management skills and adaptability in a fast-paced environment.
Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and non-experts alike.

Good To Have


Experience in applying Data Science techniques to customer retention, engagement, and lifecycle optimization.
Experience working with CRM data, A/B testing frameworks, and customer segmentation tools.
At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.


Even if it seems you don't meet our musts, don‚Äôt let it stop you! We are all about finding the best talent out there. Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
En Mango vestimos de pasi√≥n todo lo que hacemos. Con origen en Barcelona y presencia en m√°s de 120 pa√≠ses, inspiramos al mundo con creatividad, innovaci√≥n y autenticidad.

Sobre Mango

Cada Uno De Los Squads De An√°lisis Avanzado Tiene Como Objetivo Desarrollar y Evolucionar Algoritmos De Aprendizaje Autom√°tico Para Hacer Frente a Algunos De Los Principales Retos T√©cnicos y Empresariales De Mango

Aprovechando el gran volumen de datos de compras y de navegaci√≥n de los clientes, los algoritmos desarrollados incluyen recomendaciones de productos, segmentaciones de clientes o la generaci√≥n de contenido personalizado mediante IA generativa, asegurando su despliegue en tiempo real.

Title: Data Scientist Product Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the development of logistics features, quantifying the impact that they might bring to the company, supporting the design process with data to make decisions, coordinating the rollout of features, and measuring their impact.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with product and operations teams to define the product roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Apply data analytics and statistical techniques (e.g. A/B testing, multivariate testing, clustering) to uncover insights,validate product hypotheses and solve business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate product questions and hypotheses into structured analyses that drive clear, actionable outcomes
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Owning everything analytics end to end in the product development cycle, from ideation and opportunity sizing, to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Define feature optimization strategies by analyzing usage patterns and tailoring recommendations for each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology,business and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Experience with an application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights
Excellent SQL skills and experience applying those on-the-job; you know how to join multiple tables, you know how and when to use CTEs, and you use aggregate functions to come up with relevant statistics
Solid proficiency in programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

  • Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
  • Excellent spoken and written English.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

At Levi Strauss & Co, we are revolutionising the apparel business and redefining the way denim is made. We are taking one of the world‚Äôs most iconic brands into the next century: from creating machine learning-powered denim finishes to using block-chain for our factory workers‚Äô wellbeing, to building algorithms to better meet the needs of our consumers and optimize our supply chain.

Be a pioneer in the fashion industry by joining our Digital and Technology organization where you will have the chance to build exciting solutions that will impact our global business and at the be part of large and diverse data community.

The Data Science, analytics and AI team at Levi‚Äôs is responsible of building data-driven solutions that improve our existing business processes in multiple areas across supply chain, retail, revenue management and ecommerce, among others. The team is responsible for the end-to-end solution development from data ingestion until operationalisation of models in production. As a Machine Learning Engineer within this org, you will work alongside Data Scientists, Analysts, ML engineers and product management to operationalise our ML models in production on a broad set of domains, powering a data-driven transformation of our standard business procedures across channels and organizations. You will develop and deploy novel approaches to optimize existing machine learning systems to maximise their value and increase consumer satisfaction at every brand touchpoint. We need someone who will bring thoughtful solutions, perspective, empathy, creativity, and a positive attitude to solve the different challenges in our business.

You are a team player, always willing to work alongside and support your colleagues, you have a proactive and self-driven mindset towards problem-solving, looking to take on challenges and the opportunity to grow, and you are able to effectively balance solution vs risk taking.

Key Responsibilities


Work with data scientists , analysts, ML engineers and product management to create and deploy new models and ML systems.
Implement end-to-end solutions across the full breadth of ML model development lifecycle. The specific role includes working hand in hand with the scientists from the point of data exploration for model development to the point of building features, ML pipelines and deploying them in production. You will have an opportunity to work on both batch and real time models. The role also involves operational support.
Identify new opportunities to improve existing solutions towards greater accuracy and/or efficiency
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for data analyses, model development, validation and implementation
Write efficient and scalable software to ship products in an iterative, continual-release environment
Write optimized data pipelines to support machine learning models
Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team and build cloud native software for ML pipelines
Contribute to and re-use community best practices


Example Projects


Besides driving the transformation of Levi's into a data-driven enterprise in general, here are some specific projects you will work on and contribute to:
Pricing elasticity modelling and pricing recommendations
Promotional campaigns optimization and discounts recommendations
Analytics solutions to support revenue management activities


About You


University or advanced degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics, or a related field
3+ years' experience developing and deploying machine learning systems into production
Expertise in data engineering, analysis and processing (e.g. designing and maintaining ETLs, validating data and detecting quality issues)
Previous experience developing predictive models in a production environment, MLOps and model integration into larger scale applications.
Experience working with big data tools: Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, etc.
Experience with at least one cloud provider solution (AWS, GCP, Azure) and understanding of serverless code development. GCP experience preferred.
Efficiency with object-oriented/object function scripting languages, Python required.
Efficiency with Python data-handling libraries like Pandas or Pyspark.
Efficiency in SQL for data consumption and transformation. Nice to have: SparkSQL, BigQuery SQL dialects.
Expertise in standard software engineering methodology, e.g. unit testing, test automation, continuous integration, continuous deployment, code reviews, design documentation
Working experience with native ML orchestration systems such as Kubeflow, Vertex AI Pipelines, Airflow, TFX...
Relevant working experience with Docker and Kubernetes is a big plus.


LOCATION

Barcelona, Spain

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: AI ML Engineer
Description:
Descripci√≥n





Get ready. Because you‚Äôre about to embark on an AI mission to revolutionise small business and accounting practices.

Sage Copilot isn‚Äôt just an AI-powered tool. We‚Äôre developing a game changer. A tool that will help customers streamline their tasks, boost their efficiency, and unlock new opportunities. Making it a trusted business partner, the likes of which they‚Äôve never seen.

And you‚Äôll be at the forefront of its development, as part of a global team, who can‚Äôt wait to collaborate and innovate with you.

We‚Äôre working on a truly groundbreaking product. So, is this your next technology job? No‚Äîthat doesn‚Äôt do it justice. This is the future realised‚Äîfor you, for our customers, and for the shape of technology as we‚Äôve dreamed it.

We are seeking a talented and motivated A.I. Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have experience in programming, artificial intelligence, machine learning and data science.

This is a hybrid role - three days per week in our Barcelona office.

Responsabilidades principales What you'll be doing:

Teamwork: work within a team to build and maintain cloud-based solutions to support Sage‚Äôs business plans and long-term objectives by contributing to our state-of-the-art cloud architecture.

Innovation and Technology: Leverage emerging technologies to innovate and improve the Sage Copilot implementation. Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate best practices into the workstream.

Architecture and Framework: contribute to the architectural design and implementation of Sage Copilot, ensuring it meets scalability, security, and performance standards.

Collaborating: with external teams to integrate provided frameworks effectively.

Knowledge sharing: Share knowledge to help upskill wider teams on how AI technologies can be leveraged in our products. Foster a culture of continuous learning and development to ensure your skills remain cutting-edge.

Performance and Security: Monitor and optimize quality and performance whilst ensuring security protocols are followed.

Requirements:


Strong software engineering fundamentals and experience in designing, developing, and testing software applications.
Solid understanding of AI/ML principles and algorithms, particularly in areas relevant to Natural Language Processing and content generation.
Experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including their architecture, capabilities, and limitations. Familiarity with platforms like AWS Bedrock (Anthropic Claude, etc.) is beneficial.
Proficiency in Python.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS) and related services.
Understanding of API design and development.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to tackle complex technical challenges.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English to work effectively with diverse teams.
Curiosity and a passion for AI and innovation.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

We are a European startup dedicated to developing cutting-edge, automated wind-assisted propulsion systems. We aim to provide a turnkey solution for shipowners and shipping companies seeking to reduce fuel costs and emissions. Our vision is simple yet ambitious‚Äîwe aim to power the world with wind.

Imagine a world where the vast oceans are effortlessly traversed using the clean and boundless power of the wind. At bound4blue, we are turning this dream into reality. We're not just creating wind propulsion systems but revolutionizing the maritime industry, one sustainable voyage at a time. While bringing sails back to ships may seem challenging, we are more than prepared for it. We are innovators who understand the perfect harmony between nature and technology.

About The Role

The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing and implementing mathematical models, developing robust analytical solutions, and integrating AI algorithms into deployment pipelines. The role requires close collaboration with multiple teams, including Product Development, Automation & Control, Aerodynamics, and Vessel Performance, to ensure analytical tools and models are aligned with product requirements and system architecture.

This position sits at the intersection of mathematics and engineering, translating complex concepts into actionable insights and scalable models that directly support decision-making and product evolution.

Key Responsibilities


Design, validate, and implement mathematical and physical models to solve real-world engineering challenges.
Apply vectorization and numerical computing techniques to efficiently process large datasets.
Develop and deploy machine learning and artificial intelligence models into production environments.
Collaborate closely with Engineering, Product, Analytics & Control, and Vessel Performance teams to ensure models are appropriately integrated into our systems.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of deployed models, identifying opportunities for refinement.
Participate in the design of experiments, sensitivity analysis, and numerical simulations to support R&D initiatives.


Required Competencies


PhD (preferred) or master‚Äôs degree in mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
Strong foundation in mathematical modeling, linear algebra, differential calculus, statistics, and numerical methods.
Proficiency in scientific programming with Python and libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Numba, Pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with deployment pipelines and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience handling large datasets both locally and in cloud environments.
Solid understanding of computational optimization and performance via vectorization and matrix operations.
Technical English proficiency (ability to read and write scientific literature and documentation).
Experience with physical simulations, system dynamics, or solving differential equations is a strong plus.
Knowledge of mathematical optimization (linear, nonlinear, combinatorial) and experience with model versioning and monitoring tools is desirable.
Mindset oriented toward applied problem-solving and industrial innovation, ideally with experience beyond the traditional software domain.


What Awaits You


Impactful Role: Contribute directly to the design and development of advanced wind-assisted propulsion systems, playing a central role in the implementation of models that influence product decisions.
Innovation at its Core: Join a team focused on building transformative technology that merges cutting-edge science with real-world engineering applications.
Collaborative Environment: Engage daily with multidisciplinary teams across engineering and product, working together toward a shared mission of sustainable maritime transport.
Growth and Development: Take part in a fast-evolving company where your ideas and contributions help shape the future of our technology and capabilities.


Join us and make a difference in the world of sustainable maritime technology!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Intern
Description:
About Marvell

Marvell‚Äôs semiconductor solutions are the essential building blocks of the data infrastructure that connects our world. Across enterprise, cloud and AI, automotive, and carrier architectures, our innovative technology is enabling new possibilities.

At Marvell, you can affect the arc of individual lives, lift the trajectory of entire industries, and fuel the transformative potential of tomorrow. For those looking to make their mark on purposeful and enduring innovation, above and beyond fleeting trends, Marvell is a place to thrive, learn, and lead.

Your Team, Your Impact

The Central Engineering CAD organization at Marvell is a critical cog in the wheel of innovation. Without this team, Marvell would be unable to execute its vision of delivering cutting-edge technology to the world. Our team is responsible for developing design flows that are used by hundreds of engineers. These flows are instrumental in working with top-notch technologies like 3nm and 2nm, which are at the forefront of the semiconductor industry.

Every day, we work on supporting all business units within Marvell, providing them with the tools and processes they need to create their products. This gives our team members the unique opportunity to work on a variety of projects and teams, broadening their experience and knowledge. Our work directly impacts the success of the company and, by extension, the advancement of technology in the world.

We are looking for fresh graduates ready to jump start their career in the semiconductor industry and join our team in Barcelona.

What You Can Expect


Design, develop, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code for command line tools.
Apply your knowledge of algorithms and machine learning to solve complex problems and implement solutions.
Analyze and process data for feature selection. Report findings and suggest improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.


What We're Looking For


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Strong understanding of algorithms and machine learning.
Experience with Python and developing command line tools.
Familiarity with ASIC design is a plus, willing to learn ASIC design domain is a must.
Experience with classic Machine Learning algorithms and LLMs, GNNs.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Great English both verbal and written.


Additional Compensation And Benefit Elements

With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an environment of shared collaboration, transparency, and inclusivity. We‚Äôre dedicated to giving our people the tools and resources they need to succeed in doing work that matters, and to grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it‚Äôs like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

ADP is looking for the next generation of Data Scientists to join our Global Product and Technology (GPT) Development Programme.

What‚Äôs our secret to success? Well, that‚Äôs easy. People like you. We‚Äôre looking for enthusiastic new graduates to help us build the next generation of ADP technologies. As part of the GPT Development Programme, your goal is simple: learn as much as possible in your first eight weeks working with us under a permanent contract. We‚Äôll get you started with the tools, technology, and technical knowledge you need to succeed. Then, you‚Äôll be placed amongst our brightest associates as an Associate Data Scientist, joining our group of passionate technologists who make it all possible by innovating creative solutions to new challenges.

EXPERIENCE YOU‚Äôll NEED

Completing a bachelor‚Äôs or graduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent area of study
Knowledge in programming and languages such as Python or R
Knowledge in databases and SQL
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Critical thinking and an analytical mindset
Be passionate about ‚Äúnext-generation‚Äù technologies


Bonus Points For These

Familiarity with AWS cloud solutions (S3, Glue, Lambda, SageMaker)

If you‚Äôve made it down this far, we have to ask: What are you waiting for? Apply now!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Location: Barcelona, in-office

At SumUp, we are passionate about giving access to financial services to the millions of businesses too small for most providers to consider. What started as one card reader has turned into a range of readers and multiple remote payment solutions, as well as banking services, including Business Accounts and Loans.

As a Data Scientist in the Lending Tribe, you will play with a huge dataset with billions of transactions from millions of active users. From there, you will build impactful models to help businesses across multiple countries get access to credit through SumUp‚Äôs different lending products. You‚Äôll be part of a team of talented analysts, engineers, and other scientists using an advanced stack of tools to create innovative solutions for our products.

What you will do:


Improve the core lending models: credit risk scoring and affordability forecasting models using machine learning solutions
Define data collection strategies and new algorithms for models to support expansion to new market segments
Perform analyses and present your insights to enable SumUp business teams to make data-driven, mission-critical decisions (DROP)
Communicate and present results to product and business stakeholders
Mentor other Data Scientists to pursue data science excellence through good engineering practices
Build production-grade ML solutions using Python, scikit-learn, LightGBM, and PySpark‚Äîdelivered with testing, monitoring, and reproducibility baked in
Navigate and improve legacy code and pipelines‚Äîrefactor without fear, stabilise what‚Äôs brittle, and raise engineering standards across the board
Clearly communicate trade-offs and model performance to both technical and business stakeholders


You will be great for this position if you have:


Solid understanding of Data Science
Deep Python skills, including experience with (pandas, scikit-learn)
Solid SQL knowledge
Mastery of statistics, machine learning, and probability theory
Proven track record in delivering solutions end-to-end
Experience deploying machine learning models and artifacts in production at scale
Excellent technical reading, writing and communication skills to support stakeholder management


Big Plus:


Hands-on experience building or maintaining credit risk models in regulated environments
A background in software engineering‚Äîyou think in modules, write testable code, and care about long-term maintainability
Experience launching models in data-constrained or new market environments
A degree in a quantitative field: Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or similar


Why you should join SumUp:


Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup
Restaurant tickets (powered by Edenred)
Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced
A dedicated annual L&D budget of ‚Ç¨2000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education
30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp
Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team


About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder‚Äôs mentality and a 'team-first‚Äô attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Clarivate is expanding its Data Science team and looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to join us in Barcelona.

If you're passionate about advancing knowledge search and discovery, this is your chance to make an impact. You'll develop cutting-edge machine learning and AI models to enhance the user experience for customers in the intellectual property and science domains.

Our mission? To empower researchers and professionals to unlock new insights, maximize their potential, and drive meaningful innovation.

About You ‚Äì Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


An advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Technology, or Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of industry experience, including applying ML and NLP in real-world scenarios.
Excellent analytical and Python programming skills (Java and R are a plus)
Experience in Computer Vision
Effective communicator and presenter, skilled at connecting with stakeholders, gathering insights, and conveying complex ideas.
Ability to rapidly test, adapt, and implement methods‚Äîfrom data extraction to validation.


It would be great if you also had . . .


Experience with search engines, classification algorithm, recommendation systems and relevance evaluation.
Hands-on experience in Building and deploying ML pipelines.
Background in NLP solutions for he legal domain, experience in patents is a plus.
Master's or PhD with focus on AI/ML.


What will you be doing in this role?

You will research and implement ML and NLP solutions to enhance user experience in Intellectual Property data and products, with a strong focus on the patent domain. This includes identifying and validating algorithms, exploring data for insights, recommending new data sources, and uncovering innovative applications of ML and NLP within Clarivate‚Äôs extensive content and datasets.

Product you will be developing

We are working on a wide range of products involving search, predictive and other analytics, as well as decision support. You‚Äôll be helping out with new, state of the art solutions to improve the tools that help both internal and external customers drive innovation at major companies. Your main focus will be taking existing patent drafting software to the next level with all the latest AI technology.

About The Team

You'll be part of a dynamic team of eight Data Scientists based in Belgium, Spain, and the U.S., specializing in Intellectual Property data and products, including trademarks, patents, and case law. As part of a larger Data Science, Search, and Content group of 100+ professionals (including 40+ Data Scientists and ML Engineers), we collaborate closely with Product, Sales, Marketing, and Operations teams to maximize customer value. With experienced Principal Data Scientists on board, we provide strong mentorship and growth opportunities. While many of our projects are driven by customer needs, we also explore new technologies and develop proof-of-concept solutions to showcase their business impact.

Hours of Work

This is a Full-Time permanent role, in Barcelona ‚Äì Spain (40 working hours per week)

Hybrid working model, 2-3 days per week from our Office, near Sagrada Familia, central region in the city.

What We Can Offer You


An opportunity to have a real impact on the global IP industry.
30 working days of vacation
Volunteering community, with 40 paid hours of volunteering time
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten, and transport cards).


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Clarivate is expanding its Data Science team and looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to join us in Barcelona.

If you're passionate about advancing knowledge search and discovery, this is your chance to make an impact. You'll develop cutting-edge machine learning and AI models to enhance the user experience for customers in the intellectual property and science domains.

Our mission? To empower researchers and professionals to unlock new insights, maximize their potential, and drive meaningful innovation.

About You ‚Äì Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


An advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Technology, or Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of industry experience, including applying ML and NLP in real-world scenarios.
Excellent analytical and Python programming skills (Java and R are a plus)
Experience in Computer Vision
Effective communicator and presenter, skilled at connecting with stakeholders, gathering insights, and conveying complex ideas.
Ability to rapidly test, adapt, and implement methods‚Äîfrom data extraction to validation.


It would be great if you also had . . .


Experience with search engines, classification algorithm, recommendation systems and relevance evaluation.
Hands-on experience in Building and deploying ML pipelines.
Background in NLP solutions for he legal domain, experience in patents is a plus.
Master's or PhD with focus on AI/ML.


What will you be doing in this role?

You will research and implement ML and NLP solutions to enhance user experience in Intellectual Property data and products, with a strong focus on the patent domain. This includes identifying and validating algorithms, exploring data for insights, recommending new data sources, and uncovering innovative applications of ML and NLP within Clarivate‚Äôs extensive content and datasets.

Product you will be developing

We are working on a wide range of products involving search, predictive and other analytics, as well as decision support. You‚Äôll be helping out with new, state of the art solutions to improve the tools that help both internal and external customers drive innovation at major companies. Your main focus will be taking existing patent drafting software to the next level with all the latest AI technology.

About The Team

You'll be part of a dynamic team of eight Data Scientists based in Belgium, Spain, and the U.S., specializing in Intellectual Property data and products, including trademarks, patents, and case law. As part of a larger Data Science, Search, and Content group of 100+ professionals (including 40+ Data Scientists and ML Engineers), we collaborate closely with Product, Sales, Marketing, and Operations teams to maximize customer value. With experienced Principal Data Scientists on board, we provide strong mentorship and growth opportunities. While many of our projects are driven by customer needs, we also explore new technologies and develop proof-of-concept solutions to showcase their business impact.

Hours of Work

This is a Full-Time permanent role, in Barcelona ‚Äì Spain (40 working hours per week)

Hybrid working model, 2-3 days per week from our Office, near Sagrada Familia, central region in the city.

What We Can Offer You


An opportunity to have a real impact on the global IP industry.
30 working days of vacation
Volunteering community, with 40 paid hours of volunteering time
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten, and transport cards).


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: Principal Data Scientist
Description:
Location: Barcelona Office or Remote from Spain




About the Role:




At Heetch, we are looking for a Principal Data Scientist to lead and drive data science initiatives that will shape the future of our platform. You will own the end-to-end development of impactful analysis, experimentation, machine learning models and algorithms, turning complex data into actionable insights that enhance the experience of both drivers and passengers. As a technical leader, you will set the vision for data science, mentor other data professionals, and collaborate with Product Managers, Engineers, and Analysts to drive data-driven decision-making. This is a high-impact role where your work will directly influence Heetch‚Äôs strategy and growth.

Our Values

Make it happen: we get things done

Think different: we challenge, create, explore

Be kind: we lift each other up

Play for the team: because the ride is better together




What Will You Do:




- Lead data science initiatives and define best practices across the company.

- Analyse product performance to uncover growth and efficiency opportunities.

- Collaborate with product teams to deeply understand and influence roadmap priorities.

- Develop, deploy, and optimise ML models to drive product innovation.

- Architect scalable data pipelines and ensure high-quality data infrastructure.

- Design and oversee experimentation frameworks (A/B tests, causal inference, Bayesian approaches).

- Be a¬†technical expert and mentor and guide data scientists and analysts, fostering a culture of excellence.

- Present insights to leadership and stakeholders, influencing strategic decisions.




Challenges You will Face:




- Navigating large-scale datasets to uncover hidden opportunities.

- Automating data-driven decisions to improve efficiency.

- Ensuring data integrity and quality standards at scale.




Our Values:




Make it happen: we get things done

Think different: we challenge, create, explore

Be kind: we lift each other up

Play for the team: because the ride is better together




About You:




10+ years of hands-on experience in data science, with expertise in Python, SQL, and scalable data solutions.

Proven leadership experience, driving cross-functional data science projects.

Deep understanding of statistical analysis, experimentation (A/B testing), and causal inference.

Experience with machine learning and predictive modeling in a production environment.

Strong communication skills, translating complex insights into actionable business recommendations.

Hands-on experience with data visualisation, storytelling, and dashboarding tools.

Bonus: Experience deploying ML models into production or leading a data science team.




What's next?




If your application is selected, the process will be in 3 steps:

- Interview with a recruiter (45mn)

- Live test with your future team member (45min)

- A last round to meet your future manager and key stakeholders




Working at Heetch means üéâ:




Health Insurance üè•: Sanitas (50% covered)

Lunch Vouchers üçΩÔ∏è: Cobee (90‚Ç¨/month)

Transport üöã & Remote Compensation üè†: 20‚Ç¨ and 30‚Ç¨ per month, respectively

A great work environment üåü: Free fruits, snacks, coffee, and tea every day

Events üéâ: At least 1 event each month







üåà¬†Ride with Pride at Heetch¬†üåç

We‚Äôre all about building a diverse, inclusive team where everyone feels safe, seen and celebrated. Different backgrounds, perspectives, and vibes? Bring it on. That‚Äôs how we grow.




And hey ‚Äî studies show some people (especially women and early-career folks) hold back from applying unless they tick every single box. Don‚Äôt do that. If this role sparks something in you, but you‚Äôre not sure you match everything ‚Äî apply anyway. We care about potential, mindset, and energy just as much as experience.

Everyone‚Äôs welcome on the Ride üíñ

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

We are a European startup dedicated to developing cutting-edge, automated wind-assisted propulsion systems. We aim to provide a turnkey solution for shipowners and shipping companies seeking to reduce fuel costs and emissions. Our vision is simple yet ambitious‚Äîwe aim to power the world with wind.

Imagine a world where the vast oceans are effortlessly traversed using the clean and boundless power of the wind. At bound4blue, we are turning this dream into reality. We're not just creating wind propulsion systems but revolutionizing the maritime industry, one sustainable voyage at a time. While bringing sails back to ships may seem challenging, we are more than prepared for it. We are innovators who understand the perfect harmony between nature and technology.

About The Role

The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing and implementing mathematical models, developing robust analytical solutions, and integrating AI algorithms into deployment pipelines. The role requires close collaboration with multiple teams, including Product Development, Automation & Control, Aerodynamics, and Vessel Performance, to ensure analytical tools and models are aligned with product requirements and system architecture.

This position sits at the intersection of mathematics and engineering, translating complex concepts into actionable insights and scalable models that directly support decision-making and product evolution.

Key Responsibilities


Design, validate, and implement mathematical and physical models to solve real-world engineering challenges.
Apply vectorization and numerical computing techniques to efficiently process large datasets.
Develop and deploy machine learning and artificial intelligence models into production environments.
Collaborate closely with Engineering, Product, Analytics & Control, and Vessel Performance teams to ensure models are appropriately integrated into our systems.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of deployed models, identifying opportunities for refinement.
Participate in the design of experiments, sensitivity analysis, and numerical simulations to support R&D initiatives.


Required Competencies


PhD (preferred) or master‚Äôs degree in mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
Strong foundation in mathematical modeling, linear algebra, differential calculus, statistics, and numerical methods.
Proficiency in scientific programming with Python and libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Numba, Pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with deployment pipelines and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience handling large datasets both locally and in cloud environments.
Solid understanding of computational optimization and performance via vectorization and matrix operations.
Technical English proficiency (ability to read and write scientific literature and documentation).
Experience with physical simulations, system dynamics, or solving differential equations is a strong plus.
Knowledge of mathematical optimization (linear, nonlinear, combinatorial) and experience with model versioning and monitoring tools is desirable.
Mindset oriented toward applied problem-solving and industrial innovation, ideally with experience beyond the traditional software domain.


What Awaits You


Impactful Role: Contribute directly to the design and development of advanced wind-assisted propulsion systems, playing a central role in the implementation of models that influence product decisions.
Innovation at its Core: Join a team focused on building transformative technology that merges cutting-edge science with real-world engineering applications.
Collaborative Environment: Engage daily with multidisciplinary teams across engineering and product, working together toward a shared mission of sustainable maritime transport.
Growth and Development: Take part in a fast-evolving company where your ideas and contributions help shape the future of our technology and capabilities.


Join us and make a difference in the world of sustainable maritime technology!

bound4blue develops automated wind-assisted propulsion systems as a turnkey solution for all shipowners and shipping companies seeking to reduce fuel costs and polluting emissions. bound4blue‚Äôs eSAIL¬Æ system is a validated solution for saving fuel and emissions, completely autonomous, with low maintenance and easy installation onboard, being the most cost-efficient wind propulsion technology today.
